;Itinerary of Classic Inca Jungle Trail 4 days and 3 Nights
;Day 1 CUSCO – SANTA MARIA (Biking):
;From Your hotel, we will pick up at 7:30 am traveling by bus to Abra Malaga, we will down by car until San Luis which bikers will change in to the kit provided by us (gloves and helmets) following a 5 minute briefing by our professional tour guide, watching the beautiful valley of the Convention. Visit Wamanmarka archaeological site. In Santa Maria spend the night in a family lodge.(peru vacations)
;Day 2:SANTA MARIA - SANTA TERESA - TREKKING
;Around at 5.30am or 6:00 am, enjoy the breakfast after We will begin our walk along paths filled with vegetation typical of the area. We will walk through original Inca Trail segments. Then, we take a bath hot springs in Santa Teresa. Overnight in a great Hosting family.
;Day 3: SANTA TERESA -AGUAS CALIENTES
;We will wake at 7:30 am aproximately and have a delitious breakfast we will Cross hanging bridges and we will move in a barrage on the River Vilcanota, noting along the way wide variety of wildlife. we will find waterfalls from glaciers see also coca and coffee plantations we test our adventure and adrenaline .Staying overnight in Aguas Calientes in a basic lodging.
;Day 4:AGUAS CALIENTES - MACHU PICCHU - CUSCO
;An early rise today, as you will take the first bus to Machu Picchu at 5.30am, reaching Machu Picchu at 6am we'll go walk to Inti Punku (Puerta del Sol) to watch the sunrise, which with luck will coincide with a beautiful sunrise! Our guide will leave no stones unturned but feel free to challenge their knowledge of Inca history. Afterwards you have free time to dally with the llamas and show off your photographic skills. Those who still have the will can tackle Huaynapicchu, which actually looks down on Machu Picchu. A frequent bus service takes visitors back to Aguas Calientes, where you will catch the train to Ollantaytambo and then the bus to Cusco.
